(Speaking of that, if they looked through any mirrors in this new reality, it would appear normal again.) The reason that each person can function normally in their different realities (example: reading, writing) is because they were born and raised in whatever one they are in.
So, if a right-handed person switched minds with a left-handed one, they would become left-handed, but would write in such a way that you'd have to hold their writing in front of a mirror to be able to read it. If they got switched back, both people would go back to normal.

Sure there is. Up and down are relative. Saying that there is no Up or Down in space is like saying there is no acceleration or speed in space. It all depends on your frame of reference. In that case, down would be towards your body, and up would be away.

The "That's what she said" was never actually intended to be a sexual joke. Instead, in the 1750s, it referred to women, for they weren't treated equally. The joke carried on from then until it disappeared in the 60s-70s. It disappeared because people started to use it for everything (For example: "That's what my dog said"). The joke was later revived from when someone misunderstood the "That's what she said joke" as a sexual joke, Your joke is an illusion in today's media.

No, it weighs less than air.  Air is not weightless, it's just very difficult to measure how much it weighs. If it's weight were measured in a vacuum, it would be possible. And it is. And it was. And Helium weighs close to 2 amu.

Helium rises because it is lighter than most any other gas in our atmosphere, not because it weighs nothing, and certainly not because it weighs in the negatives. You might think that if it weighs less than air, but still has some weight, it might be pulled to the surface a little slower than air, but the atmosphere is actually full to the brim with gasses, and a lighter one can't push it's way into the heavier ones, like how water and oil fail settle.

Leonardo da Vinci was ambidextrous. The experiment they used to determine that helium nuclei are alpha particles was discovered by Ernest Rutherford. He made two glass bubbles, one thick and one very thin. For example, if the chromosome for right handed would be called X and the one for left handed would be called Y, the X would be applied rather than Y. So if you get the chromosomes XX and XY, you would be right handed.
